DOC.brief_summary: This study include patient age 18 65 undergo retrograde infrarenal surgery ( RIRS ) due renal stone ( ) . A total 60 patient ( male female ) recruit , randomize 2 group consist 30 patient group . The first group patient undergo RIRS ureteral access sheath ( UAS ) position prior surgery ; second group undergo RIRS without UAS . As use UAS decrease pressure renal pelvis RIRS , aim evaluate whether use UAS affect kidney function . besides routine kidney function test , namely urea creatinine , neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( NGAL ) ( specific early marker kidney function ) use assess difference kidney function . Preoperative blood urea creatinine level urine NGAL level study patient . After surgery , blood urea creatinine level study well urine NGAL level postoperative 2nd hour , 72nd hour 1st week .
DOC.brief_title: Differences Urine NGAL Levels Patients Undergoing RIRS With Without Ureteral Access Sheath
DOC.criteria: Being 1865 year old Having indication retrograde infrarenal surgery ( RIRS ) due kidney stone Patients uncontrolled diabetes mellitus diabetic nephropathy Patients blood pressure > 140/80 mmHg despite regular use antihypertensive agent ( ) Patients chronic kidney failure need dialysis Patients prerenal , renal postrenal acute kidney failure 3 month much early Patients pyelonephritis 3 month much early Patients young 18 year old 65 year Patients undergone kidney surgery within last 3 month abnormal kidney function test Patients concomitant ureter stone undergo endoscopic ureter stone treatment session
